summary: Adss six standalone husky followers in Riverwood.
descriptionHtml:
[center][/center]

[center][color=green][b]Please update mod to version 0.9 - no dialogue bug fixedÂ [/b][/color]Work in progress
[center][color=red][b]Check this [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/63598/?tab=1&navtag=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.nexusmods.com%2Fskyrim%2Fajax%2Fmoddescription%2F%3Fid%3D63598%26preview%3D&pUp=1]mod[/url] by PlagueHush that fixes 'holes' in textures and has AV package[/b][/color][/center]

______________________________________________
[b]DESCRIPTION[/b]
This mod adds six standalone husky followers in Riverwood. You don't have to be in Dawnguard to make them Your companion. You can give them three basic commands - Follow, Wait and Dismiss.

With [b]MangoMonkey's[/b] help I managed to fix huge bug. Update Your files and You should be able to recruit huskies properly now.

I used [url=https://www.youtube.com/user/DARKF0X127?feature=watch]DARKF0X127's[/url] tutorial, as I have NO IDEA about scripting. If the dialog doesn't appear at all try typing "set playeranimalcount to 0" in the console (this will dismiss any animal follower You have!).
I'd also like to allow player to have more than one husky follower at once, but again I have no idea how. [u]If anyone is interested in fixing bugs or developing this, feel free to contact me.[/u] It's WIP, so You may encounter other bugs.

The mod works pretty well with UFO.

If You want Your husky to have different eye color go to my other [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/36021/?tab=2&navtag=%2Fajax%2Fmodfiles%2F%3Fid%3D36021&pUp=1#]mod page[/url], where You can find all textures (each variant comes with green and blue eyes). Download the one You want and place it in The Elder Scrolls V Skyrim\Data\textures\actors\dlc01\armoreddog. You will find textures called for example huskyjake.dds and huskyjake2.dds - replace both of them with desired variant.


[center][/center][/center]

______________________________________________
[b]INSTALLATION[/b]
Use NMM or copy the Data folder in You main Skyrim folder and check the .esp file in launcher.


______________________________________________
[b]UNINSTALLATION[/b]
Simply delete the files from the folders or from NMM.


______________________________________________
[b]CREDITS[/b]
[url=https://www.youtube.com/user/DARKF0X127?feature=watch]DARKF0X127[/url] - scripting tutorial I used
[b]MangoMonkey[/b] - huge help in fixing bugs
[b]Edg3k[/b] - tongue texture
[b]Proxe[/b] (blenderartists.org) - eye texture base
[b]Aenkill[/b] - everything else
author: Aenkill
